description: A short connector into the East Coast Trail that is suitable as either a starting point for longer treks of the ECT or a nice In-n-Out for a sample of the ECT. This takes you to perfectly groomed trails and amazing lookouts where you will often see Whales frollicking off the coast. It has a few interesting features along it and you *MAY* wish to walk out along Torbay Point.  This is a potentially difficult, even dangerous walk where you can get quite close to the end of the point and the water.Locals fish from this area and it provides a great plac to sit and gaze.  It is very common to see whales off to either side of the point.This trail was brought to my attention by Elke @ Points East Guest Haus just up (North) the road a bit. A great place to stay and a *very* knowledgeable lady on the ECT and Newfoundland Culture in general.
directions: Go to the end of Doran's Lane from Outer Cove, just South of Torbay on Hiway #30.  Well marked trailhead is there.
title: East Coast Trail Torbay Point Connector
